question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable and ready to be displayed. I want to create a tool that showcases all products, then allows for order selection in different scenarios, and automatically generates the appropriate contract for each selected scenario upon completion.

checklist.title: Is the product showcase system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements a comprehensive product display system through HTML/JavaScript, including product catalog management, search/filter functionality, and detailed product information views. Check if it supports multiple product categories, image galleries, and product specifications display. Score 0 if basic product listing is missing, 5 if only static product display is implemented, and 10 if full interactive product showcase with filtering, sorting, and detailed views is included.

checklist.title: Is the multi-scenario order selection mechanism properly designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the system provides distinct ordering workflows for different business scenarios (e.g., bulk orders, subscription orders, custom orders). Check if scenario-specific validation rules, pricing models, and order configurations are implemented. The system should dynamically adapt UI elements and available options based on selected scenarios. Deduct 5 points if scenario switching is not smooth, and 3 points if scenario-specific business logic is incomplete. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the automatic contract generation system robust and accurate?
checklist.description: Check whether the contract generation engine correctly processes order data and generates appropriate legal documents for each scenario. Evaluate if the system uses proper templating mechanisms, supports dynamic clause insertion based on order specifics, and generates contracts in standard formats (PDF/Word). Deduct 5 points if contract templates are static without dynamic content, and 5 points if generated contracts contain formatting errors or missing critical information. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the complete order workflow and state management implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code includes comprehensive order lifecycle management, from product selection through contract generation, including order validation, modification capabilities, order history tracking, and status updates. Check if the system provides order draft saving, modification workflows, and proper state transitions. Deduct 5 points if order persistence is not implemented, and 3 points if order modification/cancellation mechanisms are missing. Give 10 points if fully implemented with proper state management.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid product selections, network failures, malformed order data, contract generation errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-powered product recommendations 2. Real-time pricing calculator with bulk discounts 3. Interactive contract preview with clause explanations 4. Order comparison tools 5. Integration with external pricing APIs). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple product filtering mechanisms coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to the core business (e.g., built-in social media sharing) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations during order processing). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating product catalog/order management/contract generation layers), component reusability, and proper data flow architecture. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if proper separation of concerns is not implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern e-commerce and business application design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching with proper brand consistency (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Professional layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Clear information hierarchy for products and orders 4) Professional typography (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for unprofessional color combinations, and 5 points for chaotic product/order layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to business application standards: 1) Product selection feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Order form transitions controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual guidance through the ordering process 4) Smooth contract generation progress indicators. Deduct 5 points for each operation without proper feedback, 3 points for laggy product browsing experience, and 5 points if critical action buttons (like 'Generate Contract') are hard to locate or unclear. The full score is 10 points.
